### Introduction
HTML5 is the latest version of the Hypertext Markup Language, used for structuring and presenting content on the web. It introduces new features and improvements, making it more powerful and versatile than its predecessors. Modernizr is a JavaScript library that detects HTML5 and CSS3 features in a user's browser, allowing developers to write conditional code based on the browser's capabilities. This documentation will guide you through the process of using Modernizr for feature detection in HTML5.

### Objective and Scope
The objective of this documentation is to provide a step-by-step guide on using Modernizr for feature detection in HTML5. It will cover the installation and setup of Modernizr, as well as how to use it to detect and handle different browser capabilities. The scope of this documentation is limited to Modernizr and its integration with HTML5.

### Requirements and Pre-requisites
To follow this guide, you will need the following:
- Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
- A text editor for writing code
- A web browser for testing

### Step-by-Step Instructions
1. Download Modernizr from the official website or include it in your project using a package manager like npm or yarn.
2. Include the Modernizr script in your HTML file by adding the following code inside the `<head>` section:
   ```html
   <script src="path/to/modernizr.js"></script>
   ```
3. Use Modernizr to detect features by adding classes to the `<html>` element based on the browser's capabilities. For example, to detect support for the HTML5 `<video>` element, you can use the following code:
   ```html
   <script>
     if (Modernizr.video) {
       document.documentElement.classList.add('video');
     } else {
       document.documentElement.classList.add('no-video');
     }
   </script>
   ```
4. Style your HTML elements based on the classes added by Modernizr. For example, you can hide the video element if the browser doesn't support it:
   ```css
   .no-video video {
     display: none;
   }
   ```

### Code Snippets and Commands
- To install Modernizr using npm:
  ```
  npm install modernizr
  ```
- To install Modernizr using yarn:
  ```
  yarn add modernizr
  ```

### Troubleshooting and Common Issues
- Make sure you include the Modernizr script before any other scripts that rely on its feature detection.
- Check the browser compatibility of the features you are detecting to ensure accurate results.
- If you encounter issues, refer to the Modernizr documentation or community for support.

### Best Practices and Recommendations
- Use feature detection instead of browser detection to write more robust and future-proof code.
- Regularly update Modernizr to benefit from bug fixes and new features.
- Minify and concatenate your JavaScript files, including Modernizr, for better performance.

### Summary and Conclusion
Modernizr is a valuable tool for feature detection in HTML5. By using Modernizr, you can write code that adapts to the capabilities of the user's browser, providing a better user experience. This documentation has provided a step-by-step guide on using Modernizr for feature detection in HTML5, along with best practices and recommendations. With this knowledge, you can confidently leverage Modernizr to build modern and compatible web applications.
